website_summaries.verdict: Though competition's increasing for low-end full-frame cameras, the Nikon D610 holds its own; that said, while slightly faster than its predecessor it's not a whole lot different.
pros: The Nikon D610 continues the D600's tradition of a great set of shooting features, comfortable and intelligent design, and excellent photo quality and performance
cons: Photos still display some unrecoverable clipping in the highlights that you don't expect in a camera of its caliber, and unlike the overhauled D5300, the D610 requires an extra-cost Wi-Fi dongle for connectivity

customer_reviews.title: Excellent full frame camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent full frame camera. Upgraded from the nikon d5200. All my photos are taken now with this camera and the nikon 50mm 1.8 lens (prime lens). Could be better in low light as you seem to get a little noise when you crank the iso up, but if you are planing to shoot when there is plenty of light you will get great images. If your planning on shooting in low light situations, like lots of weddings you should probably bump up to the d750. This camera fit my budget and was a wonderful buy, stepped up my game big time. 5 stars would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: brittany clinton

customer_reviews.title: Value: 5 stars, Overall: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: For what you pay, you receive an amazing sensor able to retain detail in a huge range of shadows and highlights. The controls and UI are logical and smooth. Great battery life, and dual SD card slots is a huge bonus. If i could ask for anything else, it would be: Higher continuous shooting rate 1080p video at 60 fps (30fps max) A swivel screen Other than those things it is perfect for my needs. I would argue the best value full frame camera. If you're looking to upgrade from your crop sensor, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great entry-level FX body
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using my D610 for about a year now and love it. Once I started doing weddings, I knew I had to make the jump to full frame. I upgraded from a D7100 and I love how it uses the same battery and memory card. It’s lightweight which I love too. On a personal note, I do wish I would’ve gone with the D750. It’s a little more expensive, but if you’re continuing to grow in photography and do weddings, I think it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J+H B

customer_reviews.title: Great camera kit for a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for me. I can point and shoot or get a little creative and explore the older art of photography. My camera is set up and aimed at the open field behind my house where I capture images of the abundant wildlife that feeds there (hunters and prey). Lens are a good mix for building a photography capability.
customer_reviews.author: vectorlogic

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Full Frame DSLR
customer_reviews.text: So glad I finally took the leap to an FX DSLR. Well worth the money! The low light performance is so far beyond that of the DX cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful magical camera
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful magical camera. I love it so much. The quality of my work has gone up so much since I started working with this new camera. It is sharp in quality and amazing with lighting. I could not recommend it more.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre Weber

customer_reviews.title: "Buy a Nikon D610"
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal camera... My last one was a D40x. This D610 feels like I just graduated. Much more capable, better functions, nicer controls, the list goes on. I'm glad I started with that D40x as an entry level to learn on, while not wasting actuations. Even more happy to have chosen this superb D610 as my next step. Wouldn't recommend it for a beginner (too much camera and too much money). Just like I wouldn't buy a Ferrari for my 16 year old ;) Savvy photographers, however - don't pass go, don't collect $200... "Buy a Nikon D610"
customer_reviews.author: joninthesprings

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Top quality on board metering. Customization of controls and exposure is great. Do not expect 24MP in JPEG format. That is reserved for RAW only which is cumbersome for most users. JPEG is 10+ MP which is more than enough for most users. Excellent value to get into a full format body on a budget. Especially of you buy gently used.
customer_reviews.author: David McChesney

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: In love with this camera even though it's an older model.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: My favorite DSLR so far
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera a while ago because I wanted to get into full frame and I liked the idea of 2 SD cards. Like any full frame it does great in low light with very little noise. The dual SD card slots are nice. The weight isn't too bad either. Combine this with a FX prime lens and you'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: David Myles

customer_reviews.title: Fast Shipping, Amazing Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect intermediate camera! My pre-teen son uses it to take photos of the products he wants to sell on eBay and I am able to switch it to manual to take my product and food photos. I love it. The seller was amazing, quick shipping and a fast response.
customer_reviews.author: Purple N Passionate

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a great buy and as an introduction to the FX world this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Wainwright Greenidge

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally broke my Nikon D610 on a trip to Hawaii and was devastated. I bought one in Used-Good and it looks amazing and works perfectly. I’m so happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Alsup

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for prior Nikon model
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement / upgrade for my Nikon D600. The camera is really great and that it came in a kit with the same two lenses I had on my previous camera was a real plus. I am looking forward to a lot of good photo shooting ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Ahearn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: perfect for what i use it for and definitely an upgrade from my crop sensor d7k
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Baugh Jr

customer_reviews.title: Feeling a little let down.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping it would be at least close to a replacement for my aged D700. Files are very nice and the high ISO stuff is great but the camera just doesn't handle well. I've had it for about a year and it still just doesn't feel right. Button locations and functions just aren't as intuitive as previous models I've used. That said, the autofocus performance (or lack of) is the real disappointment. It just isn't anywhere near what I was expecting. Video quality is very nice so long as you don't use autofocus and the built-in microphone at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Les Hassell

customer_reviews.title: Great Photos
customer_reviews.text: I wish there is no oil splash problem, otherwise, this is a gread camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: One of the best Nikon cameras I've ever owned and I had many
customer_reviews.text: One of the best Nikon cameras I've ever owned and I had many. Paired with good glass the results are excellent. I would buy it again, as a matter of fact I did , I have two.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo A.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: What a great camera. That's all I have, it's just great.....
customer_reviews.author: Neil.Ca

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D610 is awsome!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera body, I really like the fact that the controls, and setup menus are almost identical to my APS-C D7100.
customer_reviews.author: Omegatron13

customer_reviews.title: Great seller!!!
customer_reviews.text: Completely as described excellent shipping time and an amazing camera. No oil or dust so far.
customer_reviews.author: JGasPhotodotcom

customer_reviews.title: Finger print on the glass and Black spots on the picture at high exposure
customer_reviews.text: So when I received this camera I saw finger prints on the glass which is placed over mirror. Normal pictures look fine but when I did long exposure 15 seconds low aperture shot, I could see black spots(5-6) on my picture.
customer_reviews.author: Ashwini Sarode

customer_reviews.title: Photos on another level
customer_reviews.text: I moved to the D610 from a D3200 and I am impressed with the camera. The pictures have a better look to them and in low light it absolutely shines. For me it is a great balance of options and user control.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Fun at the Beach and the Rose Garden and Fashion show
customer_reviews.text: How you have to use the knob to set the self time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Camera was in good condition and pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kigozi

customer_reviews.title: Having a great time!
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed using this camera so far. No problems to speak of in the month I have been shooting with it. Much needed step up from the Nikon D5200!
customer_reviews.author: Ashton Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A good price puts professional image quality in reach for budget-conscious ...
customer_reviews.text: My D610 still is relevant, because as a wedding photographer I need a camera for 3 reasons: 1. Shoot excellent low-light images. 2. Have manageable file sizes. 3. Have excellent and unflappable AF.
customer_reviews.author: Nikkor lens

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this NIKON D-610...!!!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is that this is THE ONLY camera I will need for the foreseeable future...!!! It is absolutely wonderful --- I am a hobbyist/semi-pro and this rig works perfect for my needs! Bit pricey but it is exactly what I wanted and I am VERY happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sundown...

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I've probably shot around two thousand shots with this camera so far. No dust or any sort of trouble so I don't understand why other people would have this problem again after the d610. It really sounds like people just don't care for their cameras. As dad as image quality goes it's top of the line. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Cledson Correa Lima

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I only missed the box and the manual, everything else is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: In love with this camera
customer_reviews.text: Received a day earlier than expected! In love with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: monica m.

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished  Nikon d610
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be a great buy. The refurbished unit had only 2 flaw, no live view. One call to nikon and they had me sent it in. They replaced the sensor and completely check the camera out for other issue and renewed my warranty. Unit had only 245 actuations, so for the price, and only 1 week traveling back and forth from nikon. I ended up swing about $600.
customer_reviews.author: Ken & Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Was worried but now I DONT REGRET THE BUY AT ALL!!!
customer_reviews.text: Loving this camera more and more!!! I think the biggest worry was that the AF-Points were all condensed in the center and it wouldn't have good af in low light... but it sure proved me wrong! Af is spot on with each shot! Using VRI 70-200 and 50mm 1.8D I get awesome results and the high iso files are awesome!!! The next step is the D800-D810 but I wasnt sure if up grading to a 34 mp camera would be wise since I would have to upgrade all my storage! This was a great decision even though I wasn't to sure at first, I do not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Birge

customer_reviews.title: Cut Rate D750?
customer_reviews.text: This camera represents a compelling value equation. If you can do without a couple of functions targeted to the more professional user, you might see it as a cut rate D750. Its ability to function and produce useable images at high sensibilities, build quality, and the ability to use legacy Nikon glass puts it in a very select class of imaging equipment. Particularly of note is the crisp handling, the combination of buttons and dials, along with instantly recalled user definable parameters. Many users feel it stands head-and-shoulders above the D700, itself a real benchmark with what was at the time of its introduction unsurpassed low-light handling and imaging.
customer_reviews.author: fair review

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the pictures it generates
customer_reviews.text: My first full frame camera. Happy with the pictures it generates.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Chu

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: OMG, Love at first sight. Amazing quality and awesome price. Who needs a Mark III? Not me.
customer_reviews.author: victor c perez

customer_reviews.title: i like the fact that is a full frame and its ...
customer_reviews.text: i like the fact that is a full frame and its wonderful my only complain is that you don't get many focus points and only covers a small square of the viewfinder. not exactly the best for events like weddings
customer_reviews.author: Joan Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Excellent beginner FX format camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent beginner FX format camera. Haven't run into a single situation where I'm missing features or feel limited by the format
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Prettyman

customer_reviews.title: I consider it the best value in Nikon FX
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera 15 months ago to replace my D600 that Nikon refunded my money on. I consider it the best value in Nikon FX. It has no vices, it is well built, the image quality is exactly the same as the much more expensive D750. The AF works fine, and it's frame coverage works great for me. I use this versatile workhorse for everything from my day to day casual shooting to serious astrophotography work. It just does it all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Money VERY Well-Spent!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I can say anything bad about this camera. I upgraded from the D90, and this camera is leaps and bounds beyond what I've been use to. Much better picture quality in low lighting with minimal grain at high ISO. The sharpness and picture quality in general is amazing. I can zoom in 100X, and have the eyes of my clients still be tack sharp. This is a great camera for me as I am starting my own small business in portraiture. I am very pleased with this purchase, and will probably end up buying a second down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Contractor

customer_reviews.title: Stunning images! Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: Beware: All the bad reviews on Amazon are backlash of issues with D600. This version is supposed to fix those issues and the fix is working perfectly :) I upgraded from D3100 to D610 a few months ago. I love this camera. The images I get from this are so much better. I love the U1/U2 modes, the flash commander and infrared remote support. Much higher percentage of pictures from this camera become popular on 500px compared to D3100. Friends and family have been loving the pictures much more too. For the record I have only been using Nikon 28-300mm lens along with this body.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performs as expected
customer_reviews.text: So far the camera has performed as advertised. Very happy with the quality of the pictures and features of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Loric

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, this is the best VALUE full frame camera on the market. This camera is well built, and takes stunning images with the right lens. The dynamic range is a HUGE plus for this camera; all of my images retain a "natural" look after post processing. I'm giving 4/5 because I wish the maximum shutter speed was 1/8000 vs 1/4000. Other than that, the camera meets all expectations. I think it will be a long time before I upgrade to a new body. I would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this camera!!!! So happy I upgraded to full frame! Ive had no issues at all with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: M. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It's a good camera, just not perfect is all :p Focus could be better, and sometimes it won't take a photo quickly after startup. (with no flash)
customer_reviews.author: Clueless Clown

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these bodies. Love, love, love them in low light.
customer_reviews.author: Kayleen Gill

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This is an full-frame upgrade to my D7100 (which I still use often). Is well made...has the heft and balance needed for long lenses. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ofhcfdbb

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love it. definitely recommend this one.. unless you have enough money for a d750...
customer_reviews.author: Pierre TinelTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: good value!
customer_reviews.text: As described, used OEM product in original packaging, delivered promptly as scheduled, good value!
customer_reviews.author: John Spatafora

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D610 Rocks
customer_reviews.text: A very good camera and lives up to its pedigree
customer_reviews.author: DAS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera and quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent picture quality. FX format provided excellent quality when zooming in. FX cameras is heavier then DX format cameras, but I have no problems with the added weight. This camera is not for the novice. You should have experience with other cameras first (such as DX format cameras).
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It is my dream camera. Fully meet my expectation. This camera will give me more than what I'm capable to use.
customer_reviews.author: canon

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS NIKON D610 CAMERA!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS CAMERA! DOCUMENTATION FOR THIS NIKON D610 CAMERA CAME WITH A COMPLETE MANUAL IN ENGLISH AND THE OTHER COMPLETE MANUAL IN SPANISH! FOR THE PRICE OF THIS D610 IT SHOULD HAVE CAME WITH A LEAST 10 MEG'S OF MEMORY FOR A QUICK TRY-OUT.
customer_reviews.author: GARY A. SMILEY

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, no complaints other than I wish it had built in WIFI which I already knew before purchasing so that's on me. :)
customer_reviews.author: John Xaysongkham

customer_reviews.title: ... just tested the ISO capabilities and I am very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I just tested the ISO capabilities and I am very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Full Frame Camera
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera. I have upgraded from a D5100 to the D610. Was easy to learn and customize the menu and buttons to my preferences just using the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Came with a sweet note.
customer_reviews.text: Came with a sweet note ... loved the sweet touch of care i am enjoying my camera with an extra battery too ( which was not part of the deal) infact it was so lucky that i got my assignment the day i got it and had to go for a shoot the next day ..thanx
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best full frame for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic full frame camera for the price. I was wondering why there hasn't been an updated version yet, but maybe it's because "Why mess with perfection?" I'm only taking a star off because Nikon's menu systems are not the friendliest ever... but if you don't mind them, take all 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: This is my first FX camera going from a the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first FX camera going from a the D5200 to the D610. Amazingly sharp images once you learn the focus settings. The camera is much different from my old Nikon camera so it took a few days to learn settings and to get them where they needed to be. I will be keeping this one around for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie A. Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: It is a great camera. I am a D700 owner and I had to choose for a second body: D610 or D800? After several weddings I can say I am happy with my D610.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: Best Price Performance Nikon Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had the opportunity to field test my N610 and after one month we have found an extraordinary ruggedness, reliability and price performance and reliability compared vs D300, D300s, D600 and D800.
customer_reviews.author: Luis M. Chong

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Highly recommended with this lens!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera and a super Lens that covers whole gamut (wide angle to zoom)... but felt like I did not receive all the cables that would plug into the camera (AV etc).
customer_reviews.author: Nidumolu

customer_reviews.title: Love the D610
customer_reviews.text: Been waiting a long time to upgrade from my digital dinosaur, the D100. I was tempted to save money and go for the D7100 and I'm glad I didn't. This camera is perfect for my needs right now.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Sparbanie

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am an advanced amateur and this is my first full frame SLR. Had it for a month and love the camera. Upgraded from a D90 and D7100 which were also great, but I wanted the benefits a full frame camera provided. Nikon does a wonderful job. The camera is slightly heavier than the D7100 and with the Nikon 28-300 lens is a couple of pounds, but what a wonderful picture. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mckay Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I moved up to this camera from the Nikon d5100. I have not had it that long and I am still learning the camera, but so far I love it. Focus is great. Skin tones are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: I love the Nikon D610 camera
customer_reviews.text: I love the Nikon D610 camera. The pictures come out with such clarity over my old D3200 that I will sell my old camera. It's well worth the investment. I can't wait for summer pictures.
customer_reviews.author: George L. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic raw action shots
customer_reviews.text: This was second of two carry for bird photography, emphasis on action shots. It is my choice because cont high is 6fps, with buffer capacity of about 25 in raw format. Spectacular. Also have a D7100 which also 24 mp, but only shoots 4fps with buffer for only 4-5 shots. A fantastic raw action shots. D800 costs more but doesnt have the frame rate. I keep one body on the AFS 400 f
customer_reviews.author: DocETop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I really like this camera
customer_reviews.text: I really like this camera. It works as advertised and I haven't had any issues with oil on the sensor. I like the %100 view finder, aperture command dial, and the small LCD on top is good for seeing your settings at a glance. I also like the fact that the body is bigger than their entry level bodies. The D5200 always felt pretty small in my hands, but this feels good since I can get my pinky on the body to grip help grip it. The pictures it delivers are nice and sharp too. As long as you don't blow the focus or exposure, you will get a nice shot.
customer_reviews.author: Jason E Baker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera. The features are a bit overwhelming, but I've loved the quality. Battery life is good, flash comes in handy, video is amazing... no complaints yet.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera that's lightweight and takes beautiful pictures. I went from my D3100 to this one and I'm really pleased with my upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: micks25

customer_reviews.title: Excellent in low light/high ISO
customer_reviews.text: The things that drove me to acquire this camera were 1) the full-frame chip and 2) the performance at high ISO values & low light. As I do a lot of night photography the latter is significant advantage, even over my D7000 which isn't bad. The camera takes excellent pictures even at ISO 3200.
customer_reviews.author: Dick Locke

customer_reviews.title: would buy again, should have built in wifi
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! Been taking wonderful pictures w it! Would just be nicer if the wi/fi was built in, instead of having to use the adapter! Which works nice and is very small, but still
customer_reviews.author: Diogo

customer_reviews.title: My fantasy camera has come to life! I have ...
customer_reviews.text: My fantasy camera has come to life! I have barely touched the surface of what this camera can do and I am in heaven!
customer_reviews.author: Giggly Girls

customer_reviews.title: This is all the camera that any amateur needs.
customer_reviews.text: This is more camera than even the most serious amateur photographer will ever need or be able to manage, no amateur will neither need more or will ever master. There nothing boring about this instrument.
customer_reviews.author: James Dexter

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Have about 1600 shots and have yet to see the dreaded sensor spots. Bought it to replace a D7000/18-200mm kit and am happy thus far. Love the extra light sensitivity, as well as the ability to actually use ISO (which is useless on small frame). Am also happy with the lens. So far no creep, although I anticipate some eventually. No need to go into great detail as there are plenty of reviews for the D600 and the 28-300mm. Suffice it to say I have no complaints. Edit: Over 4,000 shots and no spots. Still no complaints about the camera. The 28-300mm lens, however, shows substantial creep.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from my nikon d3100 to the d610 and this camera has by far changed my photography for the better. I have nothing but good things to say it. HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl bentley

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Well made FX format camera. Haven't found the oil problem of the 600. I look forward to many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: The D610 impressed right from the box and it has ...
customer_reviews.text: The D610 impressed right from the box and it has improved the photo quality I produce significantly. Pair this with the Nikkor 85mm f1.8 and my oh my! You'll be whistling through your sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Komborerai Murimba

customer_reviews.title: Said I wouldn't get it till about the 8th and I got it the 6th so I was very happily surprised. Everything was packaged up and u
customer_reviews.text: Got the camera very, very quickly. Said I wouldn't get it till about the 8th and I got it the 6th so I was very happily surprised. Everything was packaged up and unscathed, the camera seems to function just fine so far and was a nice change to finally jump to a full frame, FX, camera. Very happy with this purchase. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mary T

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous low light photos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera primarily to take low light indoor photos and it has not disappointed me. The auto white balance is amazing and the noise at ISO 1600 is comparable to ISO 200 on my DX frame D3100. The great thing is that I am able to capture a lot of great indoor photos without using a flash now. Love this camera
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera so far. The photos are very vibrant and sharp. I had no problems adjusting the settings because I am a Nikon junkie anyway. I will one day give a more in depth review once I shoot more with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Angie C

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: They say this is a back up for Pro's. Nah. Aside the D800, this is THE camera to have. Don't let anyone tell you different. If you can't get the 800 GET THIS. *Update - I have taken over 5000 shots now and no oil issue. Still going with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect cam for professionals..I need to explore more. Thanks to Nikon for providing such a superb cam. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Suren

customer_reviews.title: Still Oil Spots on Sensor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera around 2 weeks back since i was going on a vacation to couple of scenic places. I was hesitant buying this camera because some people had oil spots on sensor issues with D600 and also D610. But i tried to trust nikon that they might have fixed the issue. When i started taking hte pictures and when ever the aperture is F15 or above. It started to show oil spots which disturbed me a lot. Not happy with the purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: Gurjot

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed at first but fell in love.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this in the mail and it is a used camera. I did not pay for a used camera. BUYER BEWARE. PROS: The company I bought this from immediately fixed the problem and I've had the camera for quite sometime now. Compared to my Nikon D90 the iso values have increased tremendously. The auto focus has improved greatly aswell. This camera was a great investment for me. CONS: Some of the button settings have moved around.
customer_reviews.author: APRIL Lee

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: After over a year I am still very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: OC nubi

customer_reviews.title: was a good value for a full frame sensor but returned for ...
customer_reviews.text: was a good value for a full frame sensor but returned for the D750 which is well worth the the price difference for the added features and low light performance. Wi-fi, flip screen, and higher usable iso made it a not brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: Thanks thank you thank you Love it nothing better one of the best Nikon cameras I had ever had thank you
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Great camera body
customer_reviews.text: It is as was represented to me; great back-up camera body.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M.

customer_reviews.title: First full frame camera! Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My first full frame camera and love love love it!! Even fixing it at a Nikon repair shop after my 70-200 2.8 attached to it fell on the ground and bent the top half of the lens mount completely off of the camera! I got it fixed for less than $300 and is good as new!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Just awesome
customer_reviews.text: A brilliant camera and the accessories that accompanied it made it one of my top purchases ever.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Callcut

customer_reviews.title: Really good camera but I returned it for a D750 since ...
customer_reviews.text: Really good camera but I returned it for a D750 since the D750 has a better sensor and auto focus range. If you can spend the extra money on the D750 it is well worth it for the long run.
customer_reviews.author: savvyconsumer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Love my new D610, quality built, focus speed and the rich details I get, specially shooting in raw, it is my first full frame and I really enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a friend who thinks it is wonderful. Uses it for his job and has had no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: DJ6Diablesse

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera, fantastic service from UniquePhoto. Arrived a day ahead of schedule. Just couldn't be more pleased. Will definitely shop with them in future. One thing. Lens caps do not appear to have a hole to thread a string for safekeeping. I can work on that.
customer_reviews.author: atticus

customer_reviews.title: nikon d610
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera, it takes great pictures. Has a lot of features I have not mastered yet. Will have to read the book, their is a lot to remember until you use it a lot. Would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Bet

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Full frame is definitely the way to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Full frame is definitely the way to go. I've seen a great image difference between this camera and my D7100.. Even though my D7100 is a great camera the D610 is very good and such a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A P.

customer_reviews.title: The photos are beautiful, I love it
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfection I was looking for, the full frame allows for more detail and wider angles. The photos are beautiful, I love it! it was a worthy investment
customer_reviews.author: Megan M

customer_reviews.title: I'm so in love!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love my first FX Full Frame DSLR. I'm so in love with it. Great for every lenses I had. From 105mm VR micro, 85mm 1.4 G medium telephoto/portrait, to my Manual Supertelephoto Zoom Lens. I wowed a lot on this one. ♥♥♥
customer_reviews.author: tomcat273

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D610
customer_reviews.text: So far the D610 has lived up to the purpose for which I purchased it for. The photos that I have taken did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Simpson

product_meta.title: Nikon D610 24.3 MP CMOS FX-Format Digital SLR Camera (Body Only)
product_meta.description:
Style:Body Only| Configuration:BaseThe Nikon D610 Digital SLR Camera has the power of a 24.3 MP Nikon FX-format CMOS sensor in a compact, streamlined HD-SLR body. Create brilliant full frame images and 1080p videos. Capture every detail in stunning clarity with Nikon's superior 39 point AF system with Scene Recognition. Additional features include: 6 FPS burst shooting, 3.2-inch LCD, ISO expandable to 25,600, plus much more. Focus lock: Focus can be locked by pressing shutter-release button halfway (single-servo AF) or by pressing AE-L/AF-L button.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 


Feel the power of a 24.3 MP Nikon FX-format CMOS sensor in a compact, HD-SLR body. Create dazzling full-frame images rivaled only by Nikon's D800 series D-SLR and 1080p Full HD videos. Nikon's superior 39-point AF system and Scene Recognition System means details will be clear and crisp—for static or moving subjects. HD video quality rivals more expensive dedicated video cameras. Nikon FX-format quality has never been more attainable.

EXPERIENCE THE PASSION OF NIKON FULL-FRAME PHOTOGRAPHY.
The power of a pro-level Nikon FX-format camera—dazzling full-frame images, broadcast-quality 1080p video at your fingertips, superior low-light performance, faster frame rate up to 6 frames-per-second (fps), tack sharp autofocus with 39 focus points, built-in flash with Commander Mode, wireless photo sharing and much more—is attainable in a compact, lightweight full-frame HD-SLR body. A new continuous quiet mode lets you capture a sequence of shots without the noise associated with the raising and lowering of the D-SLR's mirror. Optimized for full-frame shooting, streamlined for compactness and value, the D610 will fuel your photographic passion like never before.



NIKON'S FULL-FRAME SENSOR RAISES THE BAR ON IMAGE QUALITY
STUNNING DETAIL AND NIKKOR LENSES
Passionate photographers who seek uncompromised full-frame, high-resolution performance rely on Nikon FX-format HD-SLRs. With a level of performance only bested by Nikon's own D800 series D-SLRs, D610's 24.3 megapixel FX-format CMOS sensor, wide dynamic range and high S/N (signal-to-noise) ratio captures every detail with lifelike sharpness and low noise throughout its wide ISO range. Low-light performance is synonymous with Nikon—shoot crystal clear images from ISO 100 to 6400, expandable down to 50 and up to 25,600 for extreme situations. EXPEED 3 processing system manages all that data with remarkable speed and accuracy, enabling up to 6 fps continuous shooting at full resolution in both FX and DX formats. Whether shooting people, landscapes or close-ups—you'll marvel at D610's faithful color reproduction. Add Nikon's newest selection of affordable fast f/1.8 primes, compact wide ratio zooms with VR image stabilization or tele- and supertelephoto lenses and you'll see the full potential that the D610 offers.

REMARKABLE AF PERFORMANCE WITH COMPATIBILITY UP TO F/8
F/8 SENSITIVITY BENEFITS ACTION AND WILDLIFE PHOTOGRAPHY
One of the keys to capturing razor-sharp images is a fast, precise autofocus system, and the D610 has one of the best. 39 tightly packed focus points with wide-area AF coverage offer endless compositional possibilities. Nine cross-type sensors in the center offer superior accuracy even when light and contrast are scarce. Seven center focus points work all the way down to f/8 for extended AF functionality with teleconverters and long-reach lenses. Switch between 9, 21 or 39 point AF, allowing for compositional freedom. D610's Scene Recognition System's subject identification and tracking information means enhanced performance by 3D Tracking and Auto Area AF. When shooting photos or HD video in Live View, Nikon’s responsive contrast-detect AF activates for accurate fulltime autofocusing.

EXCEPTIONAL PERFORMANCE AND QUALITY
FLAWLESS METERING AND ONBOARD INTELLIGENCE
The D610 delivers consistently beautiful images, thanks to Nikon's intelligent Scene Recognition System with 3D Color Matrix Metering II. Its 2,016 pixel RGB sensor evaluates every scene, taking into account brightness, contrast, subject distance and the scene colors, all within the time it takes to press the shutter release button. That data is then referenced against an onboard image database for consistently accurate exposures, auto white balance, i-TTL flash and subject-tracking autofocus performance.





BROADCAST-QUALITY FULL HD VIDEO AT YOUR FINGERTIPS
TWO VIDEO FORMATS IN ONE CAMERA
Nikon is committed to developing HD-SLRs that empower and inspire filmmakers and video enthusiasts, and the D610 is proof of that. Shoot 1080p HD videos with selectable frame rates of 30p, 25p or 24p and MPEG-4 AVC/H.264 compression. Bend time with 720p HD at 60p, 50p or 30p for ultra-smooth video playback of fast moving subjects, or create slow-motion footage during post processing. Manually adjust ISO, shutter speed and aperture, activate Live View shooting's fulltime AF with face-priority and subject tracking or manually focus. Experience dedicated inputs for an optional stereo mic and headphones for monitoring sound, still image exporting, uncompressed recording of video via HDMI out to an external recorder, simultaneous live view on external monitors and much more. Multi-area mode Full HD D-Movie gives you compositional freedom using FX or DX movie formats. Enhance your video with the dramatic perspectives and depth-of-field control of Nikon's full line of NIKKOR interchangeable lenses, and you'll dazzle with every video project.

WI-FI CAMERA CONTROL AND MOBILE SHARING
OPTIONAL WU-1B WIRELESS MOBILE ADAPTER
With Wi-Fi compatibility, sharing photos is easier than ever. Connect the optional WU-1b Wireless Mobile Adapter and wirelessly transfer photos to your smartphone, tablet or any compatible Wi-Fi enabled device. Use your smartphone to instantly upload your shots to the web or email them to a friend. Install Nikon's free Wireless Mobile Adapter Utility and remotely control the D610—and shoot from your smartphone or tablet!

LIGHTING STUDIO OPTIONAL
The D610's built-in pop-up flash offers up new shooting possibilities that other cameras simply can't match—and not just in low-light situations. Even well lit subjects can benefit from a balanced fill flash for extra depth and dimension. And since the D610's flash integrates with Nikon's i-TTL system, it can act as a Commander and communicate crucial exposure information to two groups of remote flashes across three channels for accurate lighting and exceptional results. When you need the extra power, add an optional accessory Nikon Speedlight for more lighting possibilities.







SUPPLIED ACCESSORIES
 *  EN-EL15 Rechargeable Li-ion Battery
 *  MH-25 Quick Charger
 *  UC-E15 USB Cable
 *  BM-14 LCD Monitor Cover
 *  DK-21 Rubber Eyecup
 *  AN-DC10 Strap
 *  DK-5 Eyepiece Cap
 *  BF-1B Body Cap
 *  BS-1 Accessory Shoe Cap
 *  NikonView NX2 CD ROM
feature_bullets: 1080/30p, 25p or 24p or 720/60p, 50p or 30p hd video (mpeg 4 AVC/h.264)
6 frames per second continuous shooting; 100% viewfinder coverage
Single axis level in viewfinder, dual axis level in live view
